intro: Syncolostemon canescens, commonly known as the hairy synseed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems covered in a dense layer of grayish-white hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Syncolostemon canescens is often found in rocky soils and is used in some traditional Aboriginal practices.
